answers.answer: I have high blood pressure as well and I'm considered a "high risk" pregnancy... I'm 17 weeks and been on medication for it since around 12 weeks

If your BP Is ranging around 140/90 or higher you will need meds. High BP can be a precursor to preeclampsia. IMO, 2 scans a week apart isn't going to accomplish anything at that gestational age. How is the baby's size?  At 20-weeks it should be about 12-ounces. Perhaps they can do Doppler evaluation of your uterine arteries to see if the waveforms show notching. Notching can possibly indicate future preeclampsia. Do you know why the 2nd scan was ordered? Was your last scan the anatomy scan?  You are not far enough along to have a biophysical profile (BPP).
They're worried about preeclampsia with me I had urine test and have to go around 20weeks to see an specialist and get another ultrasound done..did u have hbp in earlier doctor visits?

Earlier doctor visits were fine. It's just this one my blood pressure was higher. Preeclampsia is what I'm worried about. But I found out salt can raise your bp quite a bit and it's mostly salty foods that I crave. So i am going to try to cut them out and drink a lot more water.

question: I went for my check up today and the doctor said my blood pressure is higher then it should be and wants to see me every 2 weeks. And I just had an ultrasound last week but they are making me have another one next week. What does high blood pressure cause and should I be worried? Btw I will be 20 weeks on Monday.
title: High bloodpressure.
